data.name: What you get from this service
data.value: What you get from this service

data.name: This service recommends the improvements most likely to be suitable for you based on information about your home and energy use. For example, you may receive advice on:
data.value: This service recommends the improvements most likely to be suitable for you based on information about your home and energy use. For example, you may receive advice on:

data.name: insulating your loft, walls and floor

data.name: upgrading your heating
data.value: upgrading your heating

data.name: fitting double glazing
data.value: fitting double glazing

data.name: installing solar panels
data.value: installing solar panels

data.name: There is a different service available if you would like to check if a heat pump may be suitable for your property.
data.value: There is a different service available if you would like to check if a heat pump may be suitable for your property.

data.name: Each recommendation will explain what’s involved, how much it could cost you and how much it could save on typical energy bills. You will also receive information about where to go to for more advice.
data.value: Each recommendation will explain what’s involved, how much it could cost you and how much it could save on typical energy bills. You will also receive information about where to go to for more advice.

data.name: You can then build an action plan of the recommendations you would like to act on. There will be advice on where to find accredited tradespeople to do the work, and information on where to go for further support.
data.value: You can then build an action plan of the recommendations you would like to act on. There will be advice on where to find accredited tradespeople to do the work, and information on where to go for further support.

data.name: What kind of walls does your property have?
data.value: What kind of walls does your property have?

data.name: Solid walls may be made from brick or stone. If your home was built before 1930, it’s likely to have solid walls.
data.value: Solid walls may be made from brick or stone. If your home was built before 1930, it’s likely to have solid walls.

data.name: Most homes built after 1930 have cavity walls. Cavity walls have a gap, or cavity, between the wall outside and wall inside.
data.value: Most homes built after 1930 have cavity walls. Cavity walls have a gap, or cavity, between the wall outside and wall inside.

data.name: You may have both types. For example, you have a pre-1930 home with an extension built later than 1930.
data.value: You may have both types. For example, you have a pre-1930 home with an extension built later than 1930.

data.name: Help me choose which wall type I have
data.value: Help me choose which wall type I have

data.name: Solid brick walls will have an alternating pattern, with some bricks laid across the wall so you can see the smaller ends from the outside.
data.value: Solid brick walls will have an alternating pattern, with some bricks laid across the wall so you can see the smaller ends from the outside.

data.name: If your home has cavity walls, the bricks typically have an even pattern with all bricks laid lengthways.
data.value: If your home has cavity walls, the bricks typically have an even pattern with all bricks laid lengthways.

data.name: If the brickwork has been covered, you may be able to tell by measuring the width of the wall. Measure the depth of the wall by a window or door on one of your external walls.
data.value: If the brickwork has been covered, you may be able to tell by measuring the width of the wall. Measure the depth of the wall by a window or door on one of your external walls.

data.name: If a brick wall is more than 260mm thick, then it is probably a cavity wall.
data.value: If a brick wall is more than 260mm thick, then it is probably a cavity wall.

data.name: A narrower wall is probably a solid wall. Stone walls may be thicker still but are usually solid.
data.value: A narrower wall is probably a solid wall. Stone walls may be thicker still but are usually solid.
